page.title: 06 HEALTH
page.content: WE DECIDED TO INTERVIEW SOME PEOPLE AT THE HOSPITAL.WE WERE TAKEN TO MEET THE HOSPITAL ADMINISTRATOR AND HIS DEPUTY. HE TOLD US THAT THE HOSPITAL WAS OPENED IN 1854.THERE ARE 2 PARTS TO THE HOSPITAL.THE MAIN HOSPITAL IS IN BATH ST. AND THE OTHER PART IS"ST.JAMES'"IN TRAFALGAR RD.WHICH HAS 64 BEDS FOR OLD PEOPLE,WHILE THE MAIN HOSPITAL HAS 140 BEDS.THERE ARE 140 NURSES AND ABOUT 100 DOCTORS.IT DEALS WITH EMERGENCIES AND ROUTINE MEDICAL AND SURGICAL PROBLEMS AND HAS A SPECIALIST BABY CARE UNIT. THE 2 MOST COMMON ILLNESSES ARE HEART ATTACKS AND STROKES.ABOUT 1800 NEW PEOPLE HAVE TREATMENT IN THE HOSPITAL EACH YEAR.THERE ARE 50 MATERNITY BEDS AND 6 SPECIAL BABY CARE BEDS BUT THE HOSPITAL DOESN'T HAVE A PAEDIATRICS OR INFECTIOUS DISEASES DEPT.THESE CASES ARE SENT TO DARTFORD.THE HOSPITAL HAS LESS MONEY TO SPEND IN 1986.
